item.title: Smartphones with Qualcomm chip secretly send personal data to Qualcomm
item.description: - Smartphones with Qualcomm chips are sending personal data to Qualcomm without user consent, circumventing Android's protective mechanisms and raising privacy concerns.

item.title: The EU suppressed a 300-page study that found piracy doesn't harm sales (2017)
item.description: - The EU paid €360,000 for a study on the impact of piracy on sales of copyrighted material but never released the 304-page report, possibly because it found no "robust statistical evidence of displacement of sales by online copyright infringements."

item.title: Microsoft Edge is leaking the sites you visit to Bing
item.description: - Microsoft Edge appears to be sending URLs visited by users to its Bing API website, as users on Reddit have noticed.

item.title: Transformers from Scratch
item.description: - Matrix multiplication is core to the development of transformers, which are neural networks used in natural language processing.

item.title: Use of antibiotics in farming 'endangering human immune system'
item.description: - Antibiotics used in farming are causing bacteria to become more resistant to the human immune system, according to research from the University of Oxford.

item.title: People who use Notion to plan their whole lives
item.description: - Notion, a workplace app, is increasingly being used to organize personal lives such as tracking schedules and logging habits.

item.title: A non-technical explanation of deep learning
item.description: - Neural networks learn through machine learning without being taught explicit rules or logic.

item.title: Deming Paradox: Operationally rigorous companies aren't nice places to work
item.description: - W. Edwards Deming's philosophy emphasizes operational rigor and continuous improvement, but many Western companies with such processes are not very pleasant places to work.

item.title: Shell admits 1.5C climate goal means immediate end to fossil fuel growth
item.description: - Shell has announced that continued growth in fossil fuel production is incompatible with limiting global temperature increase to 1.5°C, and their new scenario involves an immediate end to growth in oil and gas production.

item.title: Call on the IRS to provide libre tax-filing software
item.description: - Millions of US taxpayers use proprietary software like TurboTax to file their taxes and feel they have no other option, which means giving up their freedom and private financial information to a third-party company.
